title: I like to run my phone with "Display Size" set to "Largest" the only problem is the back button...
content:
I like to run my phone with "Display Size" set to "Largest". 
The only problem is the back-button's hot-area now extends all the way to the left edge of the screen which means the edge of my hand is constantly touching it.
It's incredibly annoying.
I can't use the keyboard without constantly cancelling the typing and quitting the app.
If I think about it I can grip the phone with a claw hand to make sure my palm doesn't touch the edge.
Also I can glue a piece of plastic to the corner of the screen. I actually did that for a while but it fell off.
I could also just give up on having this setting the way I want it which is what I'll probably just do.
"Larger" and "Largest" both suffer from the this problem. "Default" and "Large" are OK.
I imagine with would be particularly vexing for people with poor eyesight who actually need this feature and suddenly find their phone has become very difficult to use, so I would think this would be an accessibility issue Google would want to get on top of.
As I recall older versions of Android didn't have this issue, but I can't remember how long I've been living with it.
Does anyone have ideas for how to keep my settings the way I like them, but also add a "dead zone" on the bottom left corner of the screen?
